compbio.conservation
Class Conservation

java.lang.Object
  compbio.conservation.Conservation

public final class Conservation
extends java.lang.Object

Calculates conservation scores. Immutable and thread safe. Implements equals and hashCode, can be stored in collections.

Author:
Agnieszka Golicz & Peter Troshin

calculateScores

public java.util.Map<Method,double[]> calculateScores(java.util.Set<Method> methods)
Calculate conservation using methods from the methods set

Parameters:
methods - the set of the methods to run
Returns:
the Map of Method name -> double[] amino acid conservation score

calculateScore

Calculates the conservation using method Method

Parameters:

Returns:
score for the given method

getConservation

public static Conservation getConservation(java.io.File file,
                                           boolean normalize,
                                           java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService executor)
                                    throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                           java.io.IOException,
                                           compbio.data.sequence.UnknownFileFormatException
Reads either Clustal formatted alignment or list of Fasta formatted, aligned sequences. Return the Map Method name->double[] conservation prediction results

Parameters:
file - input file can be either fasta formatted or clustal alignement
normalize - true if results should be converted to fit in range from 0 to 1. Please note that some results cannot be normalized. Such results will be returned as is, that is no conversion will be applied irrespective of this flag!
executor - the ExecutorService to use for the parallel calculations
Returns:
the instance of the Conservation
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException - throw if the input file is not found
java.io.IOException - indicate problems with reading input/writing output
compbio.data.sequence.UnknownFileFormatException - throw if the program cannot recognise the input file format

getConservation

public static Conservation getConservation(compbio.data.sequence.Alignment alignment,
                                           boolean normalize,
                                           java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService executor)
Constructs the Conservation the instance

Parameters:
alignment - the Alignment to calculate the conservation on
normalize - true, if the results should be normalized values between 0 and 1. Please note that some results cannot be normalized. Such results will be returned as is, that is no conversion will be applied irrespective of this flag!
executor - the ExecutorService to use. Consider using ExecutorFactory provided for convenience
Returns:
the new Conservation instance

getConservation

public static Conservation getConservation(java.util.List<compbio.data.sequence.FastaSequence> sequences,
                                           boolean normalize,
                                           java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService executor)
Constructs the instance of the conservation

Parameters:
sequences - the input into the conservation algorithm
normalize - true if the results should be normalized. Please note that some results cannot be normalized. Such results will be returned as is, that is no conversion will be applied irrespective of this flag!
executor - the ExecutorService to use, please consider using ExecutorFactory for managing the executors
Returns:
the instance of the Conservation

outputResults

public void outputResults(java.io.File outFile,
                          Format format)
                   throws java.io.IOException
Outputs calculated scores in to the output file in for format format

Parameters:
outFile - the file to write the result to
format - Format the format of the results, conservation scores either with or without the alignment
Throws:
java.io.IOException - indicates problems with the output e.g the program cannot write in the outFile

A convenience method. Prints its arguments to the standard out.

Parameters:
results - the Map of Method-> conservation values to output

printResults

public static void printResults(double[] result,
                                Method method)
A convenience method. Prints its arguments to the standard out.

Parameters:
result - the array of conservation values
method - the name of the conservation method

getSMERFS

public double[] getSMERFS(int width,
                          SMERFSColumnScore score,
                          double gapTreshold)
Calculates SMERFS using the custom parameters provided

Parameters:
width - width of the window for SMERFS algorithm, default is 7
score - tells which score given to the column, either the highest score of all the windows it belongs to, or the middle column is given the score of the window for SMERFS algorithm default is SMERFSColumnScore.MID_SCORE
gapTreshold - for SMERFS algorithm default value is 0.1
Returns:
SMERFS conservation values

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
